page.title: 08WATER TREATMENT WORKS
page.content: Mannofield Treatment works, Aberdeen A new water treatment works is being built on this site at the present time. There are already 2 large 19th C reservoirs holding 81M litres of water.The new Â£5M works is part of the River Dee Abstraction Scheme. The scheme consists of a river intake at Inchgarth where water is pumped from the river into a large open reservoir, then pumped along 2 pipes to Mannofield using the disused railway line. The works will treat 37.5M gallons of water daily. The present treatment works dates back to 1866 and is no longer capable of meeting the water needs of the expanding City of Aberdeen.
